message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SD, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with the coordination of linguistic style in dialogs. It could also belong to cs.LG (Learning) as it discusses the unconscious adaptation of language styles. Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it explores the possibility of the adaptation mechanism becoming a reflex. It may also fall under cs.SD (Sound) as it deals with spoken language, and cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it discusses the social goals of language adaptation.
